name: acuteness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being very good, accurate, and showing an ability to notice very small differences: He is remembered for the acuteness of his intellect. He was distinguished by the liveliness of his conversation and the acuteness of his understanding.
the fact of being very serious or severe: The choice of drug depends upon the severity, acuteness and cause of the pain. You will have to deal with crises of varying acuteness.
More examplesFewer examplesThe whole book was written with great acuteness. It needed no special acuteness of perception to realize that John and Anne were having an affair.I realized with terrible acuteness how little trace there was of her.
